com.yahoo.bullet.common.metrics

Class MetricCollector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yahoo.bullet.common.metrics.MetricCollector

  • public class MetricCollector
extends Object
    Utility class to concurrently store frequency and average metrics for various string keys. Averages are computed by storing the absolute totals of each metric along with the counts and the actual average division is computed on extractMetrics(). This method will also reset all the metrics stored. Use this class if you want to count or average metrics periodically and with high concurrency, extract them and report them somewhere.

      A constructor that sets up the collector with an initial count of 0 for each of the given metrics.

      • average

        public void average(String key,
                    long absoluteTotal)
        Increment one instance of an average metric with the absolute total.
        Parameters:
        key - The average metric to add the total to.
        absoluteTotal - The total to add.

      • average

        public void average(String key,
                    long absoluteTotal,
                    long frequencyTotal)
        Average the given absolute total and frequency total into the metric so far.
        Parameters:
        key - The name of the average metric.
        absoluteTotal - The total of the metric being averaged.
        frequencyTotal - The total number of instances of the absolute metric provided in this call.

      • extractMetrics

        public Map<String,Number> extractMetrics()
        Gets and resets the metrics currently stored in the collector.
        Returns:
        Map of names to counts of frequencies.
